p: Star anise ( Illicium verum, Hooker f.) belongs to the Magnoliaceae or Magnolia family. Its fruit is one of the most important spices, and it is indigenous to Southeastern China. Moreover, it has many beneficial functions due to its antioxidant [ 1], antibacterial, liver cancer preventative [ 2], and insecticidal characteristics [ 3]. Star anise essential oil (SAEO), which is extracted from star anise fruits, accounts for 3â€“3.5 wt.% of fresh fruit and exceeds 8 wt.% of dried fruit by steam distillation [ 4]. SAEO is widely used in food and medicine because of its good biological activity [ 5]. It is extensively used in baked goods, confections, and alcoholic and soft drinks [ 6]. In addition, it can alleviate inflammatory responses [ 7] and is a common flavor in medicinal tea, cough mixtures, and pastilles.
